snippet: Though government forces have killed many insurgents and retaken some territory, a relentless wave of attacks has left many Nigerians living in a perpetual state of fear.
abstract: Residents of northern Nigeria and Lake Chad region have felt little impact in their daily lives from string of victories of Pres Muhammadu Buhari's forces against Boko Haram; region is subject to relentless suicide bombings that have increased in frequency even as Buhari's multinational campaign has racked up victories.

byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey reported from Dakar; and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Tony Iyare contributed reporting from Lagos, Nigeria, and Iliya Kure from Kaduna, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: Though government forces have killed many insurgents and retaken some territory, a relentless wave of attacks has left many Nigerians living in a perpetual state of fear.

headline.main: Military Victories Over Boko Haram Mean Little to Nigerians
headline.print_headline: As Military Gains Against Boko Haram, Most Nigerians Still Live in Fear
